docs.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, May 10 -- Still in a deadlock and with no progress reported, negotiators for the Ford Motor Company and the United Automobile Workers, CIO, declared an overnight recess today in their fresh efforts to halt a six-day strike that has closed the Rouge and Lincoln plants and is bringing the company's nationwide network of operations to a standstill.

headline.main: FORD NEGOTIATORS RECESS TO TODAY; No Gain Reported After Parley -- Reuther Condemns 'Red' Pickets -- 9 Plants Close

docs.abstract: talks recessed; Reuther and Thompson upbraid pickets outside negotiating bldg; more plants close
